block.p: LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Grosvenor of New York and Newport, R.I., have made knbow the engagement of their daughter, Leslie Romaine Grosvenor, to R. Marcus Holloway, the son of Lynn K. Holloway of Wilington, Del., and W. Robert Holloway of Glen Cove, L.I. A December wedding is planned.

LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Grosvenor of New York and Newport, R.I., have made knbow the engagement of their daughter, Leslie Romaine Grosvenor, to R. Marcus Holloway, the son of Lynn K. Holloway of Wilington, Del., and W. Robert Holloway of Glen Cove, L.I. A December wedding is planned.

Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Grosvenor of New York and Newport, R.I., have made knbow the engagement of their daughter, Leslie Romaine Grosvenor, to R. Marcus Holloway, the son of Lynn K. Holloway of Wilington, Del., and W. Robert Holloway of Glen Cove, L.I. A December wedding is planned.

Miss Grosvenor, a teacher at the Browning School in New York, grduated from the Chapin Shcool and Duke University and received a master's degree from Teachers College of Columbia Universtiy. Her father is an investor.

Mr. Holloway, an assoiciate in the management consulting division of Deloitte & Touche, accountants in New York, graduated from Mercersburg Academy and the University of Virginia and received an M.B.A. from Columbia. His father is the vice president of the international division of Symbol Technologies, an electronics company in Bohemia, L.I.
